intro: Osmia tomentosa, commonly known as the woolly blueberry bee, is a solitary bee species native to North America. It is characterized by its fuzzy, grayish-blue body covered in fine, white hairs. This plant is a member of the family Megachilidae and is known for its specialized nesting behavior. Osmia tomentosa primarily pollinates wild blueberries and other flowering plants. Its role in pollination is crucial for the ecological balance of its habitat.
